required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acupressure for Fatigue in Ovarian Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Acupressure for Fatigue in Ovarian Cancer Survivors

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center

clinical_study.source: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if accupressure can help reduce the severity of fatigue experienced by ovarian cancer patients. Acupressure involves applying mild to moderate physical pressure by fingers, hand or a device to specific points on the skin to try to bring about a change in the body's functioning, in this case relief from chronic fatigue.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants in the "standard of care" arm will not be blinded; however, the two self-acupressure arms will be blinded as to which acupressure treatment they have been randomized. All study staff and researchers will remain blinded until after the completion of data analyses.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in level of fatigue at week 6
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported on the Brief Fatigue Inventory (BFI)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in level of fatigue up to week 24
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported on the Brief Fatigue Inventory (BFI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life at week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported on the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Ovarian (FACT-O)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life up to week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported on the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Ovarian (FACT-O)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in sleep quality at week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in sleep quality up to week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)

arm_group.description: Using AcuWand, participants will apply acupressure to points that are known to affect physiology. Participants will also receive standard of care.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sham acupressure plus standard of care
arm_group.description: Using AcuWand, participants will apply acupressure to points that are not known to affect physiology. Participants will also receive standard of care.
Participants will receive standard of care only.

intervention.description: Six weeks of daily self-administered relaxing acupressure. Instructions will be provided for how to perform acupressure on self. A tool (AcuWand) will be provided to help participants apply the right amount of pressure on the appropriate points on their bodies. These are points that are recognized as effective in Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM).

Six weeks of daily self-administered sham acupressure. Instructions will be provided for how to perform acupressure on self. A tool (AcuWand) will be provided to help participants apply the right amount of pressure; however, the points that participants are instructed to use are not known to have any effect on the body.
intervention.arm_group_label: Sham acupressure plus standard of care

intervention.description: Fatigue management provided by participants' health care providers.
intervention.arm_group_label: Sham acupressure plus standard of care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged 21 and older
- Diagnosis of ovarian cancer, stages I to IV
- Have average persistent fatigue defined a >=4 on the Brief Fatigue Inventory at least 50% of their days for at least 3 months
- Fatigue must have started at or after the diagnosis of ovarian cancer
- Completed all primary cancer treatments (surgery, chemotherapy at least 6 months prior)
- No other planned interventions for fatigue other than current stable medication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medically unstable
- Acupuncture or acupressure receipt in past year
- Have a diagnosis of untreated mood disorder, e.g., bipolar or major depressive disorder
- Have a current diagnosis of anemia
- Have a current untreated diagnosis of hypothyroidism
- Have an initiation, a cessation or change of treatment of any chronic medications, dietary supplements, behavioral therapy, physical therapy, etc., or any planned change of medications, supplements or therapies during the study
- Have the possibility of becoming pregnant

facility.name: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center
